response_text:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><rss version="2.0" xmlns:atom="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><channel><copyright>Copyright 2016 Medical News Today</copyright><description>Latest featured health news - the top stories</description><link>http://rss.medicalnewstoday.com/featurednews.xml</link><title>Featured Health News from Medical News Today</title><webMaster>admin@medicalnewstoday.com  (MNT Admin)</webMaster><managingEditor>editors@medicalnewstoday.com  (MNT Editors)</managingEditor><atom:link href="http://rss.medicalnewstoday.com/featurednews.xml" rel="self" type="application/rss+xml" /><language>en-us</language>
<item><title>Medical News Today: Fruit compounds could help treat obesity, type 2 diabetes, and CVD</title><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 09:00:00 PDT</pubDate><link>http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/articles/310205.php</link><guid>http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/articles/310205.php</guid><description>Researchers show how a daily supplement containing compounds from red grapes and oranges may offer a promising treatment for a number of diseases, including type 2 diabetes.</description><category domain="http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/categories/fitness-obesity/">Obesity / Weight Loss / Fitness</category></item>
<item><title>Medical News Today: How fruit and alcohol impact breast cancer risk</title><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 08:00:00 PDT</pubDate><link>http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/articles/310159.php</link><guid>http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/articles/310159.php</guid><description>The lifelong risk of breast cancer seems to be lower among those who eat fruit and vegetables in adolescence and among women who reduce their alcohol intake in the midlife years.</description><category domain="http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/categories/breast_cancer/">Breast Cancer</category></item>
<item><title>Medical News Today: Colon cancer: Study finds clear link to 'jumping gene'</title><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 07:00:00 PDT</pubDate><link>http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/articles/310180.php</link><guid>http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/articles/310180.php</guid><description>While jumping genes have been found in many cancers, their direct involvement has not been clear in colorectal cancer. Now, a new study conclusively demonstrates such a role.</description><category domain="http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/categories/colorectal_cancer/">Colorectal Cancer</category></item>
<item><title>Medical News Today: MS drug may raise colorectal cancer risk</title><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 00:00:00 PDT</pubDate><link>http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/articles/310121.php</link><guid>http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/articles/310121.php</guid><description>A drug used to treat severe multiple sclerosis - mitoxantrone - has been linked to greater colorectal cancer risk in a new study. It is the first time such a link has been found.</description><category domain="http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/categories/colorectal_cancer/">Colorectal Cancer</category></item>
<item><title>Medical News Today: Why you should never make a decision when you are hungry</title><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 00:00:00 PDT</pubDate><link>http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/articles/310140.php</link><guid>http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/articles/310140.php</guid><description>A new study in rats demonstrates why making a decision when you are hungry is not a good idea. Ghrelin - a hormone released when we are ready for food - raises impulsivity.</description><category domain="http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/categories/endocrinology/">Endocrinology</category></item>
<item><title>Medical News Today: Barrett's Esophagus: Causes, Symptoms, and Treatment</title><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 00:00:00 PDT</pubDate><link>http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/articles/310144.php</link><guid>http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/articles/310144.php</guid><description>Learn about the symptoms of Barrett's esophagus, a condition where the tissue that lines the esophagus is replaced with tissue similar to the lining of the intestine.</description><category domain="http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/categories/ent/">Ear, Nose and Throat</category></item>
<item><title>Medical News Today: Yoga, meditation may reduce dementia risk</title><pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 09:00:00 PDT</pubDate><link>http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/articles/310148.php</link><guid>http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/articles/310148.php</guid><description>Older adults who engaged in a 3-month course of yoga and meditation showed memory improvements in a new study, suggesting the practices may lower dementia risk.</description><category domain="http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/categories/alzheimers/">Alzheimer's / Dementia</category></item>
<item><title>Medical News Today: Getting all mixed up: The trouble with polypharmacy</title><pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 08:00:00 PDT</pubDate><link>http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/articles/309943.php</link><guid>http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/articles/309943.php</guid><description>As people get older, their range of medications tends to grow, which can lead to problems of interactions, especially if they are taking dietary or herbal supplements too.</description><category domain="http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/categories/pharmacy/">Pharmacy / Pharmacist</category></item>
<item><title>Medical News Today: Linking hospital patient deaths to weekend staffing a major 'oversimplification'</title><pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 07:00:00 PDT</pubDate><link>http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/articles/310127.php</link><guid>http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/articles/310127.php</guid><description>Two studies on the 'weekend effect' - where hospital admission over the weekend has been linked to a higher death risk - suggest blaming staffing levels oversimplifies the issue.</description><category domain="http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/categories/emergency-medicine/">Emergency Medicine</category></item>
<item><title>Medical News Today: Heartburn drug prematurely ages blood vessels</title><pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 00:00:00 PDT</pubDate><link>http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/articles/310080.php</link><guid>http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/articles/310080.php</guid><description>Proton pump inhibitors treat heartburn with few short-term side effects. In the long term, however, they appear to raise the risk of serious problems. A new study uncovers how.  </description><category domain="http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/categories/cardiovascular/">Cardiovascular / Cardiology</category></item>
<item><title>Medical News Today: Junk food, high-fat diet may harm kidneys as much as type 2 diabetes</title><pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 00:00:00 PDT</pubDate><link>http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/articles/310081.php</link><guid>http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/articles/310081.php</guid><description>It is well established that type 2 diabetes - if untreated - can lead to kidney damage. Now, new research shows that an unhealthy diet may do just as much harm.</description><category domain="http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/categories/nutrition-diet/">Nutrition / Diet</category></item>
<item><title>Medical News Today: Bunions: Causes, Symptoms and Treatment</title><pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 00:00:00 PDT</pubDate><link>http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/articles/310096.php</link><guid>http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/articles/310096.php</guid><description>Learn all about bunions, bony bumps present at the base of the big toe joint. This article looks at how to get rid of bunions, including treatment without surgery.</description><category domain="http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/categories/bones/">Bones / Orthopedics</category></item>
<item><title>Medical News Today: Could swaddling babies for sleep raise risk of SIDS?</title><pubDate>Tue, 10 May 2016 09:00:00 PDT</pubDate><link>http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/articles/310088.php</link><guid>http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/articles/310088.php</guid><description>A review of four studies from different countries suggests there may be a link between swaddling babies for sleep and sudden infant death syndrome, and suggests some precautions.</description><category domain="http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/categories/pediatrics/">Pediatrics / Children's Health</category></item>
<item><title>Medical News Today: Malaria vaccine 'offers safe, effective protection for more than 1 year'</title><pubDate>Tue, 10 May 2016 08:00:00 PDT</pubDate><link>http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/articles/310103.php</link><guid>http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/articles/310103.php</guid><description>A clinical trial brings us closer to eradicating malaria, after finding a vaccine offered safe, effective protection against the disease in healthy adults for more than 1 year.</description><category domain="http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/categories/tropical_diseases/">Tropical Diseases</category></item>
<item><title>Medical News Today: E-cigarette and nicotine liquid poisonings increasing rapidly in young children</title><pubDate>Tue, 10 May 2016 07:00:00 PDT</pubDate><link>http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/articles/310082.php</link><guid>http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/articles/310082.php</guid><description>A new study reports a dramatic rise in young children exposed to e-cigarettes and nicotine liquid, prompting calls for stricter regulation and public education.</description><category domain="http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/categories/smoking/">Smoking / Quit Smoking</category></item>
<item><title>Medical News Today: Do artificial sweeteners during pregnancy increase risk of high infant BMI?</title><pubDate>Tue, 10 May 2016 00:00:00 PDT</pubDate><link>http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/articles/310044.php</link><guid>http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/articles/310044.php</guid><description>Artificial sweeteners are consumed in huge quantities throughout America. New research investigates their impact on the future weight of the unborn child.</description><category domain="http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/categories/fitness-obesity/">Obesity / Weight Loss / Fitness</category></item>
<item><title>Medical News Today: What are Barbiturates? Uses, Side Effects and Health Risks</title><pubDate>Tue, 10 May 2016 00:00:00 PDT</pubDate><link>http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/articles/310066.php</link><guid>http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/articles/310066.php</guid><description>Learn all about the effects of barbiturates, a class of drugs used to relax and help people sleep. This article will also look at the side effects and health risks for these drugs.</description><category domain="http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/categories/alcohol/">Alcohol / Addiction / Illegal Drugs</category></item>
<item><title>Medical News Today: Lung function measured in just a phone call with new health-sensing tool</title><pubDate>Tue, 10 May 2016 00:00:00 PDT</pubDate><link>http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/articles/310068.php</link><guid>http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/articles/310068.php</guid><description>Researchers from the University of Washington have developed a new health-sensing tool that can accurately measure lung function over a simple phone call.</description><category domain="http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/categories/asthma-respiratory/">Respiratory / Asthma</category></item>
<item><title>Medical News Today: ALS: Could pesticide exposure be a risk factor?</title><pubDate>Mon, 09 May 2016 09:00:00 PDT</pubDate><link>http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/articles/310067.php</link><guid>http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/articles/310067.php</guid><description>The risk of ALS, or Lou Gehrig's disease, may be increased with residential or occupational exposure to pesticides, according to new research.</description><category domain="http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/categories/muscular_dystrophy/">Muscular Dystrophy / ALS</category></item>
<item><title>Medical News Today: HIV antibody therapy looks promising</title><pubDate>Mon, 09 May 2016 08:00:00 PDT</pubDate><link>http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/articles/310065.php</link><guid>http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/articles/310065.php</guid><description>Researchers suggest a new antibody-based drug may offer a better way to control HIV in the longer term, after showing a single dose stimulated immune response in patients.</description><category domain="http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/categories/hiv-aids/">HIV / AIDS</category></item>
</channel></rss>
